p: CoVs are enveloped positive-sense RNA viruses that belonging to the family Coronaviridae [ 4], which is divided into four genera of viruses depending upon their genomic structure: Alphacoronavirus, Betacoronavirus, Gammacoronavirus, and Deltacoronavirus. Members of the first two of these genera are responsible for disease in humans as well as other animals [ 2]. Before the advent of SARS-CoV-2, there were six CoVs known to cause infections in humans [ 1]. Î²-CoVs that cause mild to severe respiratory diseases in humans include the novel SARS-CoV-2, which is closely related to to SARS-CoV.
